title: Supplier/Service Provider Monitoring & Control
description: Systematic procedures for evaluation, approval, and ongoing monitoring of suppliers and service providers to ensure food safety requirements are met

requirements.text: Is there a written procedure detailing how suppliers and service providers are evaluated, approved, and include the ongoing verification activities including monitoring?
mandatoryStatements: Supplier/service provider approval procedure is documented
Initial evaluation criteria are defined (certifications, audits, questionnaires, samples)
Approval process and authorization are specified
Risk-based categorization of suppliers is included
Ongoing verification and monitoring activities are defined
Re-evaluation frequency is specified based on risk
Performance criteria for continued approval are established
Procedure for suspending or removing suppliers is defined
Documentation requirements for approval and monitoring are specified
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of supplier approval procedure, quarterly verification that suppliers are monitored per procedure
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate evaluation before first use of new supplier, ongoing monitoring per defined frequency (quarterly, annually, etc.)

requirements.text: Is there a list of approved suppliers and service providers including justification for use of any emergency (temporary) suppliers or providers?
mandatoryStatements: Current list of approved suppliers and service providers is maintained
List includes supplier name, contact information, and materials/services provided
Approval date and approval status are documented
Emergency or temporary suppliers are clearly identified on list
Justification for use of emergency suppliers is documented
Emergency supplier approval follows abbreviated but documented process
List is readily accessible to purchasing and receiving personnel
List is updated promptly when suppliers are added, removed, or suspended
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of approved supplier list for accuracy and completeness, quarterly verification that only approved suppliers are used
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate update of list when supplier status changes, monthly review of purchasing records to confirm compliance

requirements.text: Are there current written food safety related specifications for all incoming products, ingredients, materials, services provided on-site, and outsourced services?
mandatoryStatements: Written specifications exist for all incoming products, ingredients, and materials
Specifications include food safety requirements (microbiological, chemical, physical, allergen)
Specifications are current and reflect latest requirements
Specifications for on-site services (pest control, sanitation, etc.) are documented
Specifications for outsourced processes are documented
Specifications are communicated to suppliers
Supplier acknowledgment or agreement to specifications is obtained
Specifications are reviewed and updated at defined intervals or when requirements change
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of all specifications for currency and adequacy, verification that specifications are communicated to suppliers
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate development of specifications before first use of new materials, quarterly review of specification updates

requirements.text: Does the organization have documented evidence to ensure that all incoming products, ingredients, materials, services provided on-site, and outsourced service suppliers comply with the approval requirements and that all supplier verification activities (including monitoring) are being followed, as defined in the supplier approval procedure?
mandatoryStatements: Records demonstrate suppliers meet approval requirements (certifications, audit reports, etc.)
Receiving inspection or testing records verify incoming materials meet specifications
Certificates of Analysis (COAs) or Certificates of Compliance (COCs) are obtained and reviewed
Third-party audit reports or certifications are current and on file
Supplier performance is monitored (quality metrics, non-conformance rates, corrective actions)
Verification activities defined in procedure are documented as completed
Non-conformances with suppliers are documented and addressed
Re-evaluation of suppliers occurs at defined intervals with documented results
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of supplier verification records, quarterly review of supplier performance data
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification at receiving for each delivery, quarterly supplier performance evaluation, immediate documentation of supplier non-conformances

requirements.text: Where food safety related testing is being performed by laboratory service providers, are these licensed and/or accredited laboratories (e.g., ISO 17025 or equivalent, national and local regulations, etc.)?
mandatoryStatements: Laboratories performing food safety testing are accredited to ISO 17025 or equivalent
Laboratory accreditation is current and covers relevant test methods
Accreditation certificates or licenses are maintained on file
Laboratories meet any national or local regulatory licensing requirements
Laboratory scope of accreditation matches testing needs
Alternative justification is documented if non-accredited lab is used (e.g., regulatory approval, rapid screening tests)
Laboratory performance is monitored through proficiency testing or split samples
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of laboratory accreditation/licensing currency, review of laboratory performance data
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification of accreditation before engaging new laboratory, annual renewal of accreditation certificates

capaInject: If supplier not properly approved before use: immediate halt of material use, conduct approval evaluation within 7 days, disposition of material received from unapproved supplier
If supplier fails to meet specifications: place supplier on hold, investigate root cause, require corrective action before releasing hold, consider alternative suppliers
If supplier verification activities not performed: conduct overdue verifications immediately, investigate gap in monitoring system, implement tracking system within 30 days
If laboratory found not properly accredited: immediate engagement of accredited laboratory, re-test recent samples if necessary, verify accreditation before future use
traceabilityInject: Approved supplier list must trace to approval documentation and verification records
Specifications must be traceable to suppliers, purchase orders, and receiving inspections
Supplier verification records must trace to specific deliveries, lots, and test results
Laboratory accreditation must be traceable to specific test reports and methods used
